title: Ticket #3558: FD leak in blahp
description:
It appears the blahp has (or had - this is on the BOSCO released version of blahp, I think) a file descriptor leak. From the end of "lsof":

remarks:
2013-Apr-01 12:05:25 by jfrey:
I did some initial code inspection and didn't see any obvious ways to leak a file descriptor to the job's proxy. I ran some tests on the proxy handling functions we add with proxy-tools.patch and didn't see any leaks on successful execution or any error conditions.

2013-Apr-01 20:16:08 by bbockelm:
What version did you use? If it's 7.9.4/5, maybe the bug got fixed by upstream?

What about proxy renewal?

2013-Apr-02 09:42:04 by jfrey:
Upstream hasn't changed recently for BOSCO or UW-Madison releases.

2013-Apr-23 09:52:30 by Francesco.Prelz:
As

1. descriptors to open files are reference-counted in OpenSSL 2. the default threading model in Globus is 'none' (mutex lock/unlock are NOPs) 3. blahpd services various commands in pthreads (and these may be operating on the same proxy file)

the 'activate_globus()' function that was patched into the blahpd should set the Globus threading model to 'pthread' (globus_thread_set_model("pthread")) so that the reference counts in OpenSSL are protected by proper mutexes.

2013-Apr-23 14:53:43 by jfrey:
Thank you for the suggestion, Francesco! I'll add the call and see if that helps.

2013-May-07 14:30:03 by jfrey:
I'm resolving this ticket, as Francesco's suggestion sounds very likely to fix the problem observed by Igor. If it doesn't, then we'll open a new ticket for additional investigation.
